businessProfile.name: Mici Italian
businessProfile.address: 2330 E Arapahoe Rd #909, Centennial, CO 80122, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 2330 E Arapahoe Rd #909, Centennial, CO 80122, USA

reviews.text:
Mici Italian absolutely delivers when it comes to fresh, satisfying Italian food with a homemade feel. I recently tried their meatballs, Caesar salad, and fettuccine Alfredo, and each dish stood out in its own way.

The meatballs were the star of the show tender, juicy, and full of flavor. You can tell they‚Äôre made from quality ingredients, and the house marinara sauce they‚Äôre served with is rich and perfectly balanced. It‚Äôs the kind of comfort food that hits just right.

The Caesar salad was crisp and refreshing, with a generous amount of shaved Parmesan and crunchy croutons. The dressing had that classic creamy tang without being too heavy just enough to coat the romaine perfectly.

The fettuccine Alfredo was creamy and indulgent without being overly rich. The pasta was cooked just right, and the sauce was smooth with a nice buttery finish. It‚Äôs a simple dish, but Mici executes it beautifully.

The service was quick and friendly, and the atmosphere was casual and welcoming great for a relaxed meal with family or friends.

If you‚Äôre craving comforting Italian classics that feel both homemade and high-quality, Mici Italian is a solid choice.

My first time trying any Mici Italian. I loved how the counter person took time to explain everything on the menu. That made my ordering a little easier.  Each table had a little vase with fresh cut flowers. The attention to detail in these two areas ia nice. The garlic bread is a mini cibatta roll which is also great-yummy bread. The spaghetti and marinara was pretty good. The downfall is the price. $4.69 to add chicken to a $14.00 entree is a little ridiculous when the chicken is scarce and clearly not fresh. It's pre- packaged chicken in precut slices that tasted bland and almost had a watery texture or consistency.  I wish the chicken were fresher and not so processed.  Another downfall is the fact that they serve Alfredo and Primavera, but do not offer linguine or fettuccine style noodles which are traditionally the noodles type that go with those sauces. I had to get spaghetti with the Alfredo which was the closest they had.  I think the flavor is there, but these things threw me off. Might stick with Noodles and Company next time which is right next door. Probably a better bang for your buck and more pasta choices. I would come back and sample some of their other menu items. It's a nice place overall.
What a great find!  All of our dishes were good and finished it off gelato.   I really loved the lasagna.  Loaded with cheese !  Micheal the owner is awesome.

We Door Dashed this. I got Alfredo and my husband got pesto. It was weird. It's tasted weird. The chicken was a small overdone, dry hockey puck.  Definitely not worth the price. I'm not sure how it got a 4.7. People like gross overpriced food I guess.

A great lunch spot! They have a $10 lunch special with a 10in pizza and a soft drink. They let you pick from their specials and it was flavorful and filling. It also came out quickly and fresh, and the staff were super nice. I'm looking forward to coming back and trying other dishes along with updating this review each time I make a trip back.

recentReviews.text: Good pizza. Great single pizza option.
Bad experience. Food was missing from our order. Amount was not credited back to our card. C'mon Man.

My first time trying any Mici Italian. I loved how the counter person took time to explain everything on the menu. That made my ordering a little easier.  Each table had a little vase with fresh cut flowers. The attention to detail in these two areas ia nice. The garlic bread is a mini cibatta roll which is also great-yummy bread. The spaghetti and marinara was pretty good. The downfall is the price. $4.69 to add chicken to a $14.00 entree is a little ridiculous when the chicken is scarce and clearly not fresh. It's pre- packaged chicken in precut slices that tasted bland and almost had a watery texture or consistency.  I wish the chicken were fresher and not so processed.  Another downfall is the fact that they serve Alfredo and Primavera, but do not offer linguine or fettuccine style noodles which are traditionally the noodles type that go with those sauces. I had to get spaghetti with the Alfredo which was the closest they had.  I think the flavor is there, but these things threw me off. Might stick with Noodles and Company next time which is right next door. Probably a better bang for your buck and more pasta choices. I would come back and sample some of their other menu items. It's a nice place overall.
Food was great pizza great salad great

We Door Dashed this. I got Alfredo and my husband got pesto. It was weird. It's tasted weird. The chicken was a small overdone, dry hockey puck.  Definitely not worth the price. I'm not sure how it got a 4.7. People like gross overpriced food I guess.
Delicious, fresh, and fast!....all delivered by a friendly staff

My husband placed the order for me to grab on my way home so I was there earlier than a pizza could be expected to be ready. They were kind, gave me some water while I waited and apologized unnecessarily for the wait. Good pizza and the antipasto salad was great!

Very pleasantly surprised. Went for a lunch with my wife. We met the owner, who was really great. Food was high quality, fast and reasonably priced‚Ä¶ got some gelato on the way out the door. Great lunch experience!

detailedReviews.text: Good pizza. Great single pizza option.

detailedReviews.author: Troll 4 The People
detailedReviews.text: Bad experience. Food was missing from our order. Amount was not credited back to our card. C'mon Man.

detailedReviews.text: Food was great pizza great salad great

detailedReviews.author: Calligo Blue
detailedReviews.text: We Door Dashed this. I got Alfredo and my husband got pesto. It was weird. It's tasted weird. The chicken was a small overdone, dry hockey puck.  Definitely not worth the price. I'm not sure how it got a 4.7. People like gross overpriced food I guess.

detailedReviews.author: Chad Jackson
detailedReviews.text: Delicious, fresh, and fast!....all delivered by a friendly staff

detailedReviews.author: Vanessa Allen
detailedReviews.text: My husband placed the order for me to grab on my way home so I was there earlier than a pizza could be expected to be ready. They were kind, gave me some water while I waited and apologized unnecessarily for the wait. Good pizza and the antipasto salad was great!

detailedReviews.author: James Maxwell
detailedReviews.text: Very pleasantly surprised. Went for a lunch with my wife. We met the owner, who was really great. Food was high quality, fast and reasonably priced‚Ä¶ got some gelato on the way out the door. Great lunch experience!

detailedReviews.author: Anthony Young
detailedReviews.text: Visiting the Denver area and I stopped in for a quick lunch. Great portion size, good flavor and amazing service. Would recommend checking it out if you are in the area

detailedReviews.author: Tiffany Sharp
detailedReviews.text:
Mici Italian absolutely delivers when it comes to fresh, satisfying Italian food with a homemade feel. I recently tried their meatballs, Caesar salad, and fettuccine Alfredo, and each dish stood out in its own way.

The meatballs were the star of the show tender, juicy, and full of flavor. You can tell they‚Äôre made from quality ingredients, and the house marinara sauce they‚Äôre served with is rich and perfectly balanced. It‚Äôs the kind of comfort food that hits just right.

The Caesar salad was crisp and refreshing, with a generous amount of shaved Parmesan and crunchy croutons. The dressing had that classic creamy tang without being too heavy just enough to coat the romaine perfectly.

The fettuccine Alfredo was creamy and indulgent without being overly rich. The pasta was cooked just right, and the sauce was smooth with a nice buttery finish. It‚Äôs a simple dish, but Mici executes it beautifully.

The service was quick and friendly, and the atmosphere was casual and welcoming great for a relaxed meal with family or friends.

If you‚Äôre craving comforting Italian classics that feel both homemade and high-quality, Mici Italian is a solid choice.

detailedReviews.author: CJ I
detailedReviews.text: Great lunch special

detailedReviews.author: david barton
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza

detailedReviews.author: Whitney Martin
detailedReviews.text: Thanks for everything!!! We had a great time and our server was very nice and helpful. Best restaurant ever!!! Great for kids - They give them dough to play with and bake. It was a great family lunch.

detailedReviews.author: Common Sense
detailedReviews.text: Food was terrible whoever gave 4 stars is terrible. Wine was a step below grape  juice. Ketchup and pasta

detailedReviews.author: Lynn Pastore
detailedReviews.text:
Never a disappointment
Consistently good

detailedReviews.author: Mark Priola
detailedReviews.text: The food here is amazing! Great staff!

detailedReviews.author: Colin Kennedy
detailedReviews.text: I love mici Lars Romine is the best chef of all time please come here if you love eating!!!!!!

detailedReviews.author: Bob Burcham
detailedReviews.text: Love their pizza. Crust is so good.

detailedReviews.author: Melissa Beamer
detailedReviews.text: I ordered the margarita pizza. It was delicious I actually finished the 11 inch pizza... That's saying a lot because I'm not a huge pizza fan.

detailedReviews.author: Wayne Harding
detailedReviews.text: What a great find!  All of our dishes were good and finished it off gelato.   I really loved the lasagna.  Loaded with cheese !  Micheal the owner is awesome.

detailedReviews.author: dlanod onailuc
detailedReviews.text: Ate there 3 times in the past 6 weeks. Gelato is rich and creamy. service is ok not bad not great. sauces tasted good only real issue I have to mention is the pasta was undercooked . each time.  I know its supposed to be al dente.. another 90 seconds in the boiling water should do the trick!

detailedReviews.author: R M
detailedReviews.text: I can never tell when I can order from here, i get email offers all the time and have ordered here before but their website now tells me they can‚Äôt confirm my location and asks me if i want to proceed.   It should be be more clear what the delivery location actually is.  I see them on the delivery apps but I also don‚Äôt feel like getting ripped off.

detailedReviews.author: Kelly Flynn
detailedReviews.text: We order take out once a week! Food is delicious and fairly priced. Staff is super friendly! Eating in is basic, but clean and nice. Kid friendly.

detailedReviews.author: Stu Lumadue
detailedReviews.text: Every time we eat this food, we say "Wow!". Everything is great!

detailedReviews.author: Hannah P
detailedReviews.text: Wonderful pasta dishes and welcoming staff!

detailedReviews.author: Andy Abols
detailedReviews.text: Excellent pizza and great price for the quality you get!  We go here all the time and our kids love the free gellato they get with the kids meal.  Owners are great people and they have a very well trained and kind staff that make you feel welcome every time.

detailedReviews.author: Tina Sawyer
detailedReviews.text: Great food. Also has Zucchini noodles

detailedReviews.author: Tyler Matzke
detailedReviews.text: Very good pizza! And nice welcoming staff.

detailedReviews.author: Holly Tripp
detailedReviews.text: Our favorite go-to for an easy and tasty Italian meal with the family. And we always appreciate the spectacular service.

detailedReviews.author: Mark Sabey
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza and Italian food ever. Delicious, unique pizza, salads, pasta and great gelato. Casual family owned place with great hospitality. Love it, absolutely love it.

detailedReviews.author: Christian Pratte
detailedReviews.text: The lunch special is 11.99. This pizza is the best in the Southglenn Plaza, the ingredients are fresh and high quality. The pizza is crunchy, cheesy, and perfectly topped with Toppings and Sauce. Infinitely better than Perry's Pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Marcus Porter
detailedReviews.text:
I love coming to Mici with my family. The food is excellent, and they have a way of making dining out with kids feel effortless. There‚Äôs no loud playground or overwhelming distractions‚Äîjust a welcoming space where kids can sit with their family, play with the little dough ball they‚Äôre given, enjoy a meal that arrives quickly, and get genuinely excited to pick out a generously portioned gelato.

Beyond the food, Mici feels like a place that brings the community together. Whether it‚Äôs families sharing a meal or the group of 15 seniors I often see gathering there, there‚Äôs a real sense of belonging. It‚Äôs clear that Mici is well-loved, and for good reason.

detailedReviews.author: Colorado Native
detailedReviews.text: Fast for pick up, fresh ingredients, delicious crust, great customer service- staff is super nice. Best pizza place in the entire area! So glad you came to Southglenn!

detailedReviews.author: Liam Fitzpatirck
detailedReviews.text:
People. There is no number or order of words, no voice, no video, that can explain to you just how good this place is. I may hyping it up a bit, but that is truly what I think. Their 10" pizza w/ a fountain drink for $10 (at least this was the deal when I went there) is by far the best thing on this planet. I got a margarita pizza, not expecting too much- but this blew me away. The perfectly crunchy pizza, with the fresh marinara, and the perfect balance of cheese~ you have no idea.

On top of having incredible food, the staff are super nice (Even giving a friend of mine a free drink), respectful, and patient!

Genuinely, this is probably my favorite restaurant of all time. If there was a way to give a 10/5 star rating, I would give them a billion out of five.

detailedReviews.author: SpaceAstroid
detailedReviews.text: My hearing aid had died shortly before arriving. I let the cashier know I couldn't hear. The cashier did a great job, annuciating his words. When the food was ready, he made sure to grab my attention, knowing I wouldn't hear him call my name. The food here is great as well. Their lunch special is pretty decent.

detailedReviews.author: Kevin St. Jock
detailedReviews.text: Great food and atmosphere on every visit!!

detailedReviews.author: Fonda Beasley
detailedReviews.text: Mici is delicious and great Italian food! We love it & it is family owned by a very nice couple!

detailedReviews.author: Rachel D'Eredita
detailedReviews.text: Can‚Äôt say enough good things about Mici! Great food made with quality ingredients. So happy to have found them.

detailedReviews.author: Kevin Stockton
detailedReviews.text: Amazing crust/pizza dough! The freshest toppings ever...try the fresh ricotta on your next pie!

detailedReviews.author: David Lewin
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza and gelato. Will definitely be back!

detailedReviews.author: Barbara Murlowski
detailedReviews.text: Loved it! Went for our first , but not last, visit!  I had marginal expectations and was pleasantly surprised.  Great choices for the whole family.  Stop by soon!

detailedReviews.author: Mrnmrtnz
detailedReviews.text: Alfredo pasta was delicious

detailedReviews.author: Daisy Blue
detailedReviews.text: My first time here at this place. Wow, I was surprised. My pizza was perfect. The marinade was well cooked with a special flavor and the lasagna was delicious.

detailedReviews.author: Beth Greenberg
detailedReviews.text: Wonderful Giordino Calzone.  (We subbed sausage for artichokes).  Best crust and not too cheesy.  Big enough to split.  The wine is nice and $7 for a glass of Prosecco makes this a yummy and affordable local place for folks in Southglen and Highlands Ranch.  Hardworking staff are pleasant.

detailedReviews.author: Lori Bradshaw
detailedReviews.text: We heard about this place from the news and had to come see for ourselves. It surpassed our expectations! The family pictures on the wall made you want to know more about the family history, and were a beautiful tribute to the family recipes being served. The calzone was DELICIOUS! I ordered the pizza to-go because why not? Jen made my husband and I feel right at home and she was so friendly! We will DEFINITELY come back for the food, the atmosphere, and the staff (absolutely LOVED JEN!)

detailedReviews.author: Austin Corell
detailedReviews.text:
The pizza is thin, and the crust is quite crispy. The ingredients seem fresh. The margherita pizza is what I usually get, and it's always great. The staff members are engaging and attentive. They have tasty gelato, too. The pasta is creamy and tasty, and the calzones are crispy and able to be handheld.

Also, they will play Italian opera sometimes, which I think is a nice touch.

Also, there are multiple restaurants, but I think they're all owned by a single Colorado family.

detailedReviews.author: Kent Goodwin
detailedReviews.text: The pizzas are fantastic, but just experienced their lasagna and ricotta calzone was disappointing.  The calzone was basically cheesy bread with very little ricotta was nonexistent.  The lasagna was watery and bland.  This was a take out experience.

detailedReviews.author: Pokey Chuckleberry
detailedReviews.text: Their garlic bread are day old toast points. I wanted a half loaf

detailedReviews.author: Dawnette Weber
detailedReviews.text: Excellent pizza üçï So fresh and so delicious!

detailedReviews.author: Anthony Kinsey
detailedReviews.text: The food was great. My kids and wife loved it. It was our first time here so it took a little to order but the staff was nice. The kids meal price really saved us some money to be able to eat out.

detailedReviews.author: Jeanette Edwards
detailedReviews.text: I ordered the Pina calzone and added Gorgonzola to it and this is the absolute tastiest calzone I ever had!!! Absolutely delicious, fresh zucchini and cooked to perfection ü§§ü§§ü§§ thank you for an amazing linner lol

detailedReviews.author: Shawn Hansson
detailedReviews.text: The pizzas are amazing

detailedReviews.author: Amanda Montgomery
detailedReviews.text: It's the best pizza in Denver. Seriously though. Do yourself a favor and GET ONE. Save room for Gelato too, it's fire üî•

detailedReviews.author: Crystal Morales
detailedReviews.text: Amazing food! All the way from El Paso Texas . Great customer service

detailedReviews.author: Brittany
detailedReviews.text: Really enjoy the food but you need more than one person working the front and more than two in the kitchen on a busy evening where you offer kids meals for $2. Quoted 20 mins for pick up and waited 30+ minutes and order was inaccurate. Staff looked very overwhelmed. Additionally lots of confusion on the pickup process as pickup orders are not placed in the designated pickup area.

detailedReviews.author: Andrew Gray
detailedReviews.text: Don‚Äôt try to call them they‚Äôll just hang the phone up on you or put you on hold forever

detailedReviews.author: J M
detailedReviews.text: A great lunch spot! They have a $10 lunch special with a 10in pizza and a soft drink. They let you pick from their specials and it was flavorful and filling. It also came out quickly and fresh, and the staff were super nice. I'm looking forward to coming back and trying other dishes along with updating this review each time I make a trip back.

detailedReviews.author: Lyn Jimenez
detailedReviews.text: The food was great like always. The cashier, host, server was very drab and lacked any type of emotions she was there just to get a check it seemed like. There was no pep in her step. And she seemed bothered when I asked her for a box and she forgot half of our order so ya it was not the best mici experience.

detailedReviews.author: The Drywall Artist LLC
detailedReviews.text: Good Lord! Best calzone I've ever had hands-down! Service was top-notch, don't miss out!

detailedReviews.author: Crystal Cardenas Raulston
detailedReviews.text: My family LOVES this place.  The food is so good, the employees and owners and incredibly nice, and the feel is so casual but not "fast food" atmosphere.  Everytime I try something new, I'm completely hooked.  Don't even get me started on the Gelato...

detailedReviews.author: Megan Speese
detailedReviews.text: I placed an online order for two personal pizzas, and wow. They were both so delicious, my order was ready a few minutes before the predicted time, and the lady who greeted me and grabbed my order was so friendly! My husband and I were very pleased and will definitely be back!

detailedReviews.author: Debra Weskamp
detailedReviews.text: Their PIZZA is the best around, salads are amazing!

detailedReviews.author: Alli May
detailedReviews.text: Always consistent in all aspects. Fast, fresh and delicious with quality ingredients. The vela has to be my favorite pizza of anywhere. We love Mici

detailedReviews.author: Landon Verbrugge
detailedReviews.text: Great pepperoni & mushrooms pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Craig Becker
detailedReviews.text: This place has the best pizza and most delicious crust.

detailedReviews.author: Lauren Pfarr
detailedReviews.text: We love their Caesar salad and pizzas. Absolutely delicious.

detailedReviews.author: Savannah Thompson
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza! I really enjoyed the quality of the pizza, the accuracy of time when the food would be ready.

detailedReviews.author: Daniel Melameth
detailedReviews.text: Great food, awesome service and kids almost eat for free. Win. Win. Win.

detailedReviews.author: ReAnne Funk
detailedReviews.text:
So so good! The pasta is ok, but the pizza!
The pizza here is the closest thing to a true Italian pizza crust I‚Äôve found so far in the States. The Digirolomo is where it‚Äôs at: pepperoni, peperoncini, Gorgonzola, mozzarella.
Oh man‚Ä¶
The people take the cake, though. Everyone we have ever interacted with has been so amazing. They consistently go above and beyond.
Seriously. If you haven‚Äôt gone to check them out yet, here‚Äôs your sign. You won‚Äôt be sorry!

detailedReviews.author: Aaron T
detailedReviews.text: I will never order pizza from any other place except Mici's. It makes my day better stopping by during work and getting amazing food in a place with a great atmosphere. Everyone here is always so pleasant and happy, too.

detailedReviews.author: Matt Richards
detailedReviews.text: I'm a huge fan of this place. The pizza is really good, with a crust that is like pastry. Lately I have been having the cassa salad, which is delicious. They have a lunch special with a personal pizza and a soda that is so inexpensive it's almost like they're paying you to eat it. Run, don't walk, to Mici Italian.

detailedReviews.author: Simon Head
detailedReviews.text:
Super kid friendly, $2 kids meals and they'll bring out a spare piece of pizza dough for kids to play with if you ask!
Oh and the food is great and quick, too!

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.6/5 rating across 100 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about the fresh, satisfying Italian food with a homemade feel, highlighting dishes like tender meatballs and creamy fettuccine Alfredo. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The service is consistently described as quick and friendly, contributing to a welcoming and relaxed dining atmosphere. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
Families appreciate the kid-friendly environment, complete with interactive activities like giving dough for kids to play with and bake. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this
improvementOpportunities: Negative reviews and reputation issues regarding food quality and service, such as missing items, bland chicken, and overwhelmed staff - review management can address this concern
Long wait times and overwhelmed staff during busy periods, leading to inaccurate orders and customer dissatisfaction - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Poor online visibility and confusion about delivery options, leading to frustration and potential loss of business - SEO services can solve this visibility issue

positive.author: Jonathan Soto
positive.text: Food was great pizza great salad great

neutral.author: Pete Lagomarsino
neutral.text: Good pizza. Great single pizza option.

neutral.author: Jaime R Channin
neutral.text: My first time trying any Mici Italian. I loved how the counter person took time to explain everything on the menu. That made my ordering a little easier.  Each table had a little vase with fresh cut flowers. The attention to detail in these two areas ia nice. The garlic bread is a mini cibatta roll which is also great-yummy bread. The spaghetti and marinara was pretty good. The downfall is the price. $4.69 to add chicken to a $14.00 entree is a little ridiculous when the chicken is scarce and clearly not fresh. It's pre- packaged chicken in precut slices that tasted bland and almost had a watery texture or consistency.  I wish the chicken were fresher and not so processed.  Another downfall is the fact that they serve Alfredo and Primavera, but do not offer linguine or fettuccine style noodles which are traditionally the noodles type that go with those sauces. I had to get spaghetti with the Alfredo which was the closest they had.  I think the flavor is there, but these things threw me off. Might stick with Noodles and Company next time which is right next door. Probably a better bang for your buck and more pasta choices. I would come back and sample some of their other menu items. It's a nice place overall.

negative.author: Troll 4 The People
negative.text: Bad experience. Food was missing from our order. Amount was not credited back to our card. C'mon Man.

negative.author: Calligo Blue
negative.text: We Door Dashed this. I got Alfredo and my husband got pesto. It was weird. It's tasted weird. The chicken was a small overdone, dry hockey puck.  Definitely not worth the price. I'm not sure how it got a 4.7. People like gross overpriced food I guess.

negative.author: Common Sense
negative.text: Food was terrible whoever gave 4 stars is terrible. Wine was a step below grape  juice. Ketchup and pasta

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
